definition: health bureau (or office, or department, or agency)
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: In 1994, Dr Chan was appointed Director of Health of Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 1994年，陳博士被任命爲香港衛生署署長。

sentences.english: The Department of Health also provides 25 beds for general out-patient clinics and maternity homes located in the outlying islands.
sentences.chinese: 衛生署也爲離島的普通科門診和留產院提供25張病。

sentences.english: Department of Health also provides 25 beds for general out-patient clinics and maternity homes located in the outlying islands.
sentences.chinese: 衛生署也爲離島的普通科門診和留產院提供25張病。

sentences.english: HIV infections were reported to DH in the fourth quarter of 2006.
sentences.chinese: 本季度衛生署共收到九十八個愛滋病病毒感染個案。

sentences.english: This work was supported in part by the United States Public Health Service and ALSAC.
sentences.chinese: 該研究部分由美國公共衛生署與ALSAC提供支持。

sentences.english: Data were compiled from the daily reports of the Centre for Health Protection, Department of Health of Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 地圖數據源自衛生署衛生防護中心發佈的每日報告。

sentences.english: The Department of Health is concerned about the report of outbreaks of meningococcal meningitis in Eastern China.
sentences.chinese: 衛生署關注華東爆發腦膜炎雙球菌的報導。

sentences.english: The Department of Health had always denied that the jab was the cause of Robert's disability.
sentences.chinese: 衛生署一直否認那刺戳是羅伯特殘疾的原因。

definition: World Health Organization (WHO)/abbr. for 世界衛生組織|世界卫生组织[Shi4 jie4 Wei4 sheng1 Zu3 zhi1]
to refer sb to an agency (or hospital etc)/referral

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Wei4 sheng1 Zu3 zhi1

definition: joint signatures (on a letter or declaration)
to call on (sb to do sth)/to appeal (to)/an appeal
